basics.name: Jimmy Lo
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Jimmy has been a tech geek ever since programming on the Apple IIe in high school. He went on to study computer science at Georgia Tech and work for several design and web development firms. Most recently he has worked at the DeKalb Library as their in-house programmer, responsible for all facets of their online presence. While that was fun, he is excited to branch out and work in a team environment again. He values good design, good code, and learning new things.

work.summary: Performed an array of work from web design and development to video shooting and editing for various clients
Moved the library from a 90's style static page to a fully interactive online presence.
highlights: Completely revamped the library's website from backend to frontend, making information responsive, accessible, and editable
Created an app for librarians to enter programs for publication on the website's events calendar as well as on TV screens that greet patrons as they enter the library
Built a complete intranet solution to facilitate communication within the organization
Started and created content for DCPLive (blog) and DCPLink (newsletter)
Created a multi-faceted online presence for the library to reach its patrons on Twitter, Facebook, Flickr, Pinterest, and YouTube
Created and maintained three podcasts delivering original audio content to patrons

work.summary: Key member of a small web development team making sites for local small businesses in Tucson, Arizona.
highlights: Created PHP and MySQL driven e-commerce sites under strict deadlines
Helped develop and conceive a PHP-based content management system for use across client sites

work.summary: Worked closely with a team of graphic designers to deliver beautiful, effective websites for clients.
highlights: Implemented large-scale, interactive, and dynamic websites using HTML, Flash, Actionscript, and ASP
Created smooth user experiences from visual designs

work.summary: Assisted in the development of Word Pro, a word processing application for the desktop.
